page.title: 10ASHDOWN FOREST MOTORISTS
page.content: A survey taken in the car-parks on a typical summer Sunday afternoon showed that this part of the Forest is popular for outings from towns within about an hour's drive. The young and the old seem to enjoy it most. Families with children and dogs came mainly to walk, perhaps with some special purpose such as studying plants and insects, flying kites or photography. Elderly and sometimes infirm people preferred to sit in or beside their cars and admire the panoramic and beautiful views. In fine weather there are picnics but fires and camping are not allowed. Some people had brought friends from further away for whom this was a first visit but 25% of those questioned said they came most weeks and almost all had been a number of times before.
